goal.ch: This theory and practice-based course seeks to provide students with conceptual and practical tools for motivating the act of translation, reassessing prevalent binaries in conceptualizing translation, translation as a public service and projects of foreignization, translation, and mediation that involve inter/intra relations of languages, mediums, forms and fields. To do so, we will weigh in on relevant theoretical resources by exemplifying the practice of translation.
goal.en: This theory and practice-based course seeks to provide students with conceptual and practical tools for motivating the act of translation, reassessing prevalent binaries in conceptualizing translation, translation as a public service and projects of foreignization, translation, and mediation that involve inter/intra relations of languages, mediums, forms and fields. To do so, we will weigh in on relevant theoretical resources by exemplifying the practice of translation.

outline.ch: This course provides students with relevant concepts, techniques, and materials in performing translation tasks.  Through lectures and guided discussions, we will work with real-world texts taken from translations of different genres and topics, including news and media reportage, ads and commercials, fiction and humor in films, websites and games, etc. Students will have opportunities to participate in a project and adapt texts and media to multilingual and multicultural environments. The purpose is to expand students' awareness of various ways of approaching translation.
